title: Development Workflow
description: Push, pull, and sync your code

cards.task: Push local files to the script
cards.description: Uploads your local code files to Google Apps Script, syncing your changes to the cloud.
cards.whenToUse: After making local code changes that you want to deploy to the cloud.
scenarios: Development workflow: Pushing changes after testing locally
Initial upload: Pushing code after creating a new local project
Team sync: Uploading your changes for teammates to pull

cards.task: Auto-push code changes whenever files are saved
cards.description: Monitors local files and automatically pushes changes whenever you save.
cards.whenToUse: During active development when you want instant synchronization.
scenarios: Rapid development: Making frequent small changes and testing immediately
Live debugging: Watching logs while editing locally with auto-sync
Paired programming: One person codes while another tests in the editor

cards.task: Force push to overwrite cloud changes without confirmation
cards.description: Pushes local code and overwrites cloud changes without asking for confirmation.
cards.whenToUse: When you're certain your local version is correct and want to overwrite cloud.
scenarios: Undo web edits: Restoring from local after accidental web editor changes
CI/CD pipeline: Automated deployments where manual confirmation isn't possible
Solo development: You know you're the only one working on it

cards.task: Pull script files from the cloud
cards.description: Downloads the latest version of your Apps Script project from Google Drive.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to sync cloud changes made in the online editor to your local environment.
scenarios: Sync after web edits: Pulling changes you or a teammate made in the editor
Collaboration: Retrieving updates from collaborators
Starting local work: Getting the latest before making changes

cards.task: Pull a specific version number to your local machine
cards.description: Downloads a specific historical version instead of the latest code.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to recover or examine a specific saved version.
scenarios: Time travel debugging: Pulling version 15 to see code before refactoring
Production recovery: Pulling the version currently deployed
Comparison: Pulling an old version to compare against current code

cards.description: Displays the synchronization status between your local files and the cloud version.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to see what changes will be pushed.
scenarios: Pre-push review: Checking which files changed before pushing
Sync verification: Confirming local and cloud are in sync
Change tracking: Identifying which files were modified

cards.task: Open the Apps Script editor in browser
cards.description: Opens your Apps Script project in the online editor in your web browser.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to access the web editor for settings or features not available in clasp.
scenarios: Visual editing: Opening the editor to use the UI builder
Project settings: Accessing triggers, libraries, or permissions
Quick checks: Verifying how your code appears in the online editor

cards.description: Opens the Google Doc, Sheet, Form, or Slides that your script is bound to.
cards.whenToUse: When working with container-bound scripts and you need to access the parent document.
scenarios: Sheet testing: Opening the bound spreadsheet to test custom menus
Form configuration: Accessing the form your script processes
Document context: Viewing the document while developing automation
